alert.note: Alert for Clermont; Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 5:56AM EDT until September 05 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, Brown, Clermont, Clinton and Warren. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wilmington, Loveland, Milford, Blanchester, Forestville, Amelia, Waynesville, Terrace Park, Batavia, Morrow, Camp Dennison, Withamsville, The Village of Indian Hill, Woodville, Maineville, Owensville, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Goshen and Martinsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
